channel.title: Works ZMAP?
channel.description:
Hey,
first of all thanks for this very nice Distro. So far everything but zmap runs perfectly. I have tried zmap with uwt but it will not work.
[code]root@host:/home/user# uwt -t 5 -i 10.152.152.10 -p 9055 zmap --bandwidth=1M --target-port=80 173.194.112.194/24 --output-file=results.csv Nov 13 18:30:05.351 [WARN] blacklist: ZMap is currently using the default blacklist located at /etc/zmap/blacklist.conf. By default, this blacklist excludes locally scoped networks (e.g. 10.0.0.0/8, 127.0.0.1/8, and 192.168.0.0/16). If you are trying to scan local networks, you can change the default blacklist by editing the default ZMap configuration at /etc/zmap/zmap.conf. 18:30:05 libtorsocks(402): sendto: Connection is a UDP or ICMP stream, may be a DNS request or other form of leak: rejecting. Nov 13 18:30:05.354 [INFO] zmap: output module: csv 0:00 0%; send: 0 0 p/s (0 p/s avg); recv: 0 0 p/s (0 p/s avg); drops: 0 p/s (0 p/s avg); hits: 0.00% 18:30:05 libtorsocks(402): sendto: Connection is a UDP or ICMP stream, may be a DNS request or other form of leak: rejecting. 18:30:05 libtorsocks(402): sendto: Connection is a UDP or ICMP stream, may be a DNS request or other form of leak: rejecting. 18:30:05 libtorsocks(402): sendto: Connection is a UDP or ICMP stream, may be a DNS request or other form of leak: rejecting. 18:30:05 libtorsocks(402): sendto: Connection is a UDP or ICMP stream, may be a DNS request or other form of leak: rejecting. ... ... ... [/code]
nmap works fine by the way. has someone tried zmap? any ideas?

item.title: Works ZMAP?
item.dc:creator: Malte
item.description:
Hey,

first of all thanks for this very nice Distro. So far everything but zmap runs perfectly. I have tried zmap with uwt but it will not work.

root@host:/home/user# uwt -t 5 -i 10.152.152.10 -p 9055 zmap --bandwidth=1M --target-port=80 173.194.112.194/24 --output-file=results.csv Nov 13 18:30:05.351 [WARN] blacklist: ZMap is currently using the default blacklist located at /etc/zmap/blacklist.conf. By default, this blacklist excludes locally scoped networks (e.g. 10.0.0.0/8, 127.0.0.1/8, and 192.168.0.0/16). If you are trying to scan local networks, you can change the default blacklist by editing the default ZMap configuration at /etc/zmap/zmap.conf. 18:30:05 libtorsocks(402): sendto: Connection is a UDP or ICMP stream, may be a DNS request or other form of leak: rejecting. Nov 13 18:30:05.354 [INFO] zmap: output module: csv 0:00 0%; send: 0 0 p/s (0 p/s avg); recv: 0 0 p/s (0 p/s avg); drops: 0 p/s (0 p/s avg); hits: 0.00% 18:30:05 libtorsocks(402): sendto: Connection is a UDP or ICMP stream, may be a DNS request or other form of leak: rejecting. 18:30:05 libtorsocks(402): sendto: Connection is a UDP or ICMP stream, may be a DNS request or other form of leak: rejecting. 18:30:05 libtorsocks(402): sendto: Connection is a UDP or ICMP stream, may be a DNS request or other form of leak: rejecting. 18:30:05 libtorsocks(402): sendto: Connection is a UDP or ICMP stream, may be a DNS request or other form of leak: rejecting. ... ... ...

nmap works fine by the way. has someone tried zmap? any ideas?

Read full topic
